filmography.title: Storm in a Teacup
filmography.role_description: An idealistic reporter who takes on a pompous politician over the rights of a local dog owner.
filmography.plot: A reporter writes an article attacking a local politician for his harsh treatment of a woman who couldn't pay her dog's license fee.

filmography.title: The Citadel
filmography.role_description: A society doctor who tempts the protagonist away from his idealistic roots toward a lucrative practice.
filmography.plot: An idealistic doctor starts out treating the poor in a Welsh mining village but is seduced by the wealth of London society.

filmography.title: Sidewalks of London
filmography.role_description: A successful songwriter who becomes a rival to Charles Laughton's busker character for the affections of Vivien Leigh.
filmography.plot: A street performer takes a young pickpocket under his wing and helps her become a star, only to be left behind as she rises to fame.

filmography.title: Night Train to Munich
filmography.role_description: A British intelligence officer who goes undercover as a German soldier to rescue a scientist from the Nazis.
filmography.plot: A British agent poses as a Nazi officer to rescue a Czech scientist and his daughter from the Gestapo.

filmography.title: Major Barbara
filmography.role_description: A Greek scholar who joins the Salvation Army to win the heart of the dedicated Major Barbara.
filmography.plot: A wealthy munitions manufacturer donates to the Salvation Army, causing a moral crisis for his daughter, a Major in the organization.

filmography.title: Blithe Spirit
filmography.role_description: A novelist haunted by the ghost of his mischievous first wife after a séance goes wrong.
filmography.plot: A spiritualist medium accidentally summons the spirit of a writer's first wife, who proceeds to torment him and his current wife.

filmography.title: The Rake's Progress
filmography.role_description: A charming but irresponsible playboy who wastes his life and talents, leading to tragic consequences.
filmography.plot: A man from a privileged background drifts through life, exploiting friends and family and failing to find purpose until WWII.

filmography.title: Anna and the King of Siam
filmography.role_description: The stubborn but curious King of Siam who hires a British governess to modernize his country and educate his children.
filmography.plot: An English widow travels to Siam to become the governess to the King's children, engaging in a battle of wills and cultures.

filmography.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
filmography.role_description: The blustery, spectral sea captain who haunts a seaside cottage and falls in love with the widow who moves in.
filmography.plot: A young widow forms a unique relationship with the ghost of a seaman and writes his memoirs.

filmography.title: The Foxes of Harrow
filmography.role_description: A charming Irish gambler who builds a plantation empire in New Orleans but struggles to win the love of his aristocratic wife.
filmography.plot: An illegitimate Irishman rises to power in 1820s New Orleans, building a plantation and a troubled family dynasty.

filmography.title: Unfaithfully Yours
filmography.role_description: A famous conductor who suspects his wife of infidelity and fantasizes elaborate revenge plots while conducting an orchestra.
filmography.plot: A symphony conductor suspects his wife of cheating and imagines three different ways to handle the situation during a concert.

filmography.title: Escape
filmography.role_description: A man wrongly convicted of manslaughter who escapes prison and is hunted across the English countryside.
filmography.plot: After defending a woman from a police officer, a man accidentally kills him and is sentenced to prison, from which he escapes.

filmography.title: The Four Poster
filmography.role_description: A husband whose marriage is chronicled entirely within the confines of his bedroom over several decades.
filmography.plot: The history of a marriage is told through scenes set in the couple's bedroom, spanning from their wedding night to old age.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup (Best Actor)

filmography.title: King Richard and the Crusaders
filmography.role_description: The wise and chivalrous Saracen leader who respects and battles King Richard during the Third Crusade.
filmography.plot: King Richard the Lionheart battles deceit within his own camp and the Saracen leader Saladin during the Crusades.

filmography.title: The Constant Husband
filmography.role_description: An amnesiac who discovers he has seven wives and must navigate the legal and romantic consequences.
filmography.plot: A man wakes up in a Welsh hotel with no memory, only to discover he is a serial bigamist with multiple wives.

filmography.title: The Reluctant Debutante
filmography.role_description: A witty British aristocrat who tries to help his American stepdaughter navigate the London social season.
filmography.plot: A British lord and his American wife try to launch their daughter into society, but she falls for a drummer instead of a duke.

filmography.title: Midnight Lace
filmography.role_description: The charming husband of a wealthy American heiress who is being terrorized by a stalker in London.
filmography.plot: A newlywed American woman in London is threatened by a stalker, but no one believes her.

filmography.title: Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The powerful Roman dictator who conquers Egypt and falls in love with Cleopatra, leading to his assassination.
filmography.plot: The story of the romance between the Egyptian queen Cleopatra and the Roman commander Julius Caesar, followed by Mark Antony.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: My Fair Lady
filmography.role_description: An arrogant phonetics professor who wagers he can transform a Cockney flower girl into a duchess; his signature role.
filmography.plot: Snobbish phonetics Professor Henry Higgins agrees to a wager that he can make flower girl Eliza Doolittle presentable in high society.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor (Musical/Comedy)

filmography.title: The Yellow Rolls-Royce
filmography.role_description: A British aristocrat who buys a Rolls-Royce for his wife, only to discover her infidelity in the back seat.
filmography.plot: Three stories about the lives and loves of those who own a specific yellow Rolls-Royce Phantom II.

filmography.title: The Agony and the Ecstasy
filmography.role_description: The warrior Pope who clashes with Michelangelo over the painting of the Sistine Chapel ceiling.
filmography.plot: The biographical story of Michelangelo's troubles while painting the Sistine Chapel at the urging of Pope Julius II.

filmography.title: The Honey Pot
filmography.role_description: A wealthy eccentric who stages a fake deathbed scene to trick his former mistresses, inspired by 'Volpone'.
filmography.plot: A millionaire pretends to be dying to see which of his former lovers is most deserving of his fortune.

filmography.title: Doctor Dolittle
filmography.role_description: A physician who shuns human patients in favor of animals, with whom he can talk in their own languages.
filmography.plot: A doctor turns to treating animals after discovering he can speak their language, leading to a search for the Great Pink Sea Snail.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song ('Talk to the Animals')

filmography.title: A Flea in Her Ear
filmography.role_description: A dual role as a dignified lawyer and a drunken hotel porter in this farce of mistaken identities.
filmography.plot: A woman suspects her husband of infidelity and sets a trap for him at a hotel, leading to chaos.

filmography.title: Staircase
filmography.role_description: An aging gay barber who bickers with his longtime partner while facing a legal charge.
filmography.plot: An aging gay couple who own a barber shop in London struggle with their relationship and personal crises.

filmography.title: Crossed Swords
filmography.role_description: A scheming nobleman in this adaptation of 'The Prince and the Pauper'.
filmography.plot: A poor boy and the Prince of Wales exchange identities, but the prince's evil uncle plans to seize the throne.

filmography.title: Ashanti
filmography.role_description: An anti-slavery official who helps a doctor track down his kidnapped wife in Africa.
filmography.plot: A doctor's wife is kidnapped by slave traders in West Africa, and he embarks on a desperate journey to rescue her.
